creator: shopov.bogomil

content:
Hello,

The error message you’re encountering indicates that the recipient’s email server has rejected the email address pgbentley101@gmail.com. This can happen for several reasons:

  • Non-Existent Email Address: The email address might not exist, or there could be a typo in the address. Double-check the email address for any errors.
  • DNS Problem: If this error occurs with every email you try to send, it could be a DNS issue. Clearing your DNS cache might resolve the problem.
  • Anti-Spam Filter: The recipient’s email server may have marked your email as spam. In this case, the recipient needs to whitelist your email address.
  • DBEB Blocking: If you’re using Microsoft 365 and sending emails to public folders, Directory Based Edge Blocking (DBEB) might be preventing the emails from being delivered. Ensure that the public folders are hosted on-premise.

To troubleshoot, start by ensuring the email address is correct and try sending the email again. If the problem persists, consider the other the possibilities mentioned above.

Best Regard, Ryan Manus CoveredCalifornia
creator: ryan1969manus

content: If all the computers use IMAP, then when you delete a message, it is deleted for all.
creator: davidsk

content: The addressbook is in the root of the profile folder, and name is abook.sqlite. You can locate it by this: - help>troubleshootinginformation - scroll down to 'profile folder' and click 'open profile' -the abook.sqlite file is in the folder you are now viewing. There may be others, such as abook-1.sqlite. Ignore any of those. - if you collect addresses from senders, they will be in the history.sqlite file.
creator: davidsk
